original_title: Sri Lanka may have to raise debt limit: Minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka may need to raise the debt ceiling in the near future as revenues are not enough to meet all expenses including interest, Cabinet spokesman Transport Minister Bandula Gunawardana said.
The Finance Ministry in the next few weeks will inform parliament about “restructuring debt and raising the debt limit” Minister Gunawardana told reporters.
The Transport Ministry has also requested funds for urgent repairs of roads which could not be accommodated by the Treasury immediately, he said.
He expected the debt limit to be raised so that state expenses are met, he said.
Many foreign funded projects are at a standstill, after Sri Lanka defaulted on its foreign debt and projects were halted, he said.
The Asian Development Bank, to which Sri Lanka has not defaulted has agreed to provide 53 million dollars, he said. (Colombo/May31/2023)
